value.0:
<StartAction>[You seem to approach mid-conversation between the Scout and the Lieutenant.]</Start>
"Yes, definitely make sure the men are still watching that treeline. We still don't know what's lurking in these woods." <StartAction>[The Lieutenant turns to regard you.]</Start> "Is there something I can do for you?"

<StartAction>[The Lieutenant seems a little taken aback.]</Start> "I'm sorry my <Lord/Lady>, but every caravan coming through Fort Olehm needs to be searched for Shadow Weave artifacts and hostile agents."
"We are nearly done. Please excuse me, my <Lord/Lady>. I did not know that you were being kept waiting."

"New to Tethyr, eh? Hrm.  Well I don't got time for a history lesson, but the short and sweet of it is we're a large and rich nation sat right between two others - Amn to the North and Calimshan to the south, so you can imagine what the atmosphere is like.  Ruled by Queen Anais.  A strong handed Queen, but fair.  Given the tragedies of her early reign, I'd say her persistence is inspiring."

"The people of Tethyr are a kind and understanding lot...At least in the Crown Lands. I've found the northerners to be a bit more pig-headed in my time here. Make sure you respect Calishite customs, too. That will get you far, no matter what you aim to do."

"Never refuse shisha. Never insult Calimshan. Never insinuate that where you're from is more cultured. Never refuse food offered. Never acuse them of poisoning food. The list goes on and on. But, most Tethyrians have Calishite heritage. You're best to remember that."

"Tethyrians take the gods quite seriously." <StartAction>[The man eye-balls you closely.]</Start> "All of the gods need their due respect, but you must obey the laws and rulings on religion unless you want to see your body from a new angle."
"You can find a copy of Tethyrian codes with a county magistrate...Sometimes orders are also posted to the local boards."
"Don't know much about it, personally. It's quite isolated and I've not been that far."
"From the travelers heading back this way we hear they're a good-sized chunk of land that sits smack in the center of several trade routes.  Plenty of opportunity there, for sure."
"Yes, sometimes. This is a major trade road, hence why we are here protecting it. However, you'll likely have better luck finding anything you need in Brost."

<StartAction>[The Scout eagerly perks up.]</Start> "The Tethir Road, between Brost and Trailstone. This is Fort Olehm. We guard the passage that takes that name and protect Tethyr from the Amnian forces sent from Hillfort Torbold."
"This section of the road is relatively safe for travel and if you continue on you should reach Brost in another two days."
"Is there anything else we can help you with?"
"Is there a horse I can borrow?"
